info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 4 at 6:02PM CDT until July 4 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Dawson.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly some rural county roads and small creeks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated continued light to moderate rain in much of the Advisory area, with the very- heaviest rain from a few hours ago having since ended. However, thanks to a widespread 1.5 to 3.5 inches of rain so far this afternoon-evening, minor flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Fortunately, additional rainfall this evening should only be around one-half inch or less before rain mostly ends for the night. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Buffalo Creek, West Buffalo Creek, Plum Creek, Gallagher Canyon State Recreation Area, East Buffalo Creek, French Creek and Spring Creek.
- Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lexington, Cozad, Gothenburg, Eddyville, Willow Island and Farnam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING
